text: Great hunting, but you will run into some folks ( not everyone) that think it's there personal hunting club.  They think they own the national Forest. If they start griping I always tell them if you want to hunt by yourself join a hunting club. All 3 bucks were takin by the camp within 200 yrds of the rd. If you think you have to walk miles you don't. Just get out there be safe and have fun.

name: Danny Moody

name: Robb Hereford
text: This place is a paradise for boys, my son loves it!

name: Jon Jett
text: I was a counselor at Camp Laney 1980-81. Had the time of my life.

name: J L
text: Went to Camp Laney back in the 60's.  Knew the Laney family and it was a great time.  A wonderful opportunity to learn a lot about outdoors and how to become a Christian man.  I would recommend to everyone.  Topnotch facilities, staff, owners, teachers and campers.  A+++

name: Scott Tidwell
text:
I spent two weeks at camp Laney at the age of twelve, that was in 1973 or '74. I remember having a great time at crafts and playing in the river, canoeing and swimming. I got a little homesick and members of the staff consoled me and made me feel better. I loved the sense of freedom I had there.
I went to my first dance there and was petrified to ask a girl to dance. With a little prodding from my counselor I overcame that fear and was able to ask a pretty young girl to dance. I remember that I was on top of the world after that night with a newly found sense of confidence.
I really enjoyed my stay at camp Laney and I hated to leave when the two weeks were up. I think back on those days of freedom and fun often and wish I could turn back time one more time.
If you're thinking of sending your young man to a summer camp I highly recommend Camp Laney. It will be a summer that they will enjoy and remember for the rest of their lives.
Thank you Camp Laney, Scott Tidwell. 57yrs old.

name: Will Settle
text: An amazing boys camp. My son had the time of his life last year, as I did 30 years ago. Can’t wait to take him back next year. He is already fired up about seeing the friends he made this past summer.

name: Rab Stewart
text: I spent at least a portion of every summer at Camp Laney from the time I was 8 until I was 21. Unless you've experienced how fun it is to attend and work at camp, it's very hard to describe its greatness. I would encourage all parents to give their sons the opportunity to spend time at Camp Laney. It's a great combination of excellent people and facilities. Thank you Rob and Whitney for all you do to create life-long memories and friendships.

name: Dan Whalen
text: My son absolutely loved this Camp. It was his first away camp ever and he didn't want to come back. They really make sure that there are plenty of counselor's to take care of all the kids and make them feel comfortable. He will come back to this camp for as long as he's allowed.

name: Ford Cleveland
text: By far one of the best experiences of my life. By going to this camp, you learn valuable skills, make lifelong friends, and have a great time. I recommend Camp Laney to anyone looking to have a great summer.

name: Amanda Cook
text: The boys love this place. Great experience for them.

name: Southern AF “Southern AF” Clothing
text: Awesome place for  boys. Teaches them so much. The counselors were awesome.

name: CL W
text: Both my boys attended Camp Laney until they aged out. I can honestly say that they both loved it! Both boys went at least one year each not knowing another camper, and still had a terrific time. I can say it was tough on me, not being in touch with them ( neither wrote home , I finally learned if they needed me, the camp would call).  While it is expensive, especially with 2 there at the same time I can honestly say, we as a family could never pack so much in 2 weeks. It presented them with new opportunities, new friends, new foods, you get where I'm headed here. My boys both had RX they had to take daily, and with the Nurses on site, they did receive it each day. I can't say enough good things about Camp Laney, and the memories my boys will have for a lifetime.

name: Jay Parcelewicz

As you can tell that there memories of that Camp we have never forgotten

The food here is not the best,  is better than most BSA summer camps, but is still ok. They have a waterslide that may look small, like it would end, and be over fast, but it is really fun. If you are a boy scout and you are in Alabama, this is a great place for summer camp. The staff is so friendly and this is a beautiful piece of land. Have fun.

I have made situpons, S'mores, go carts, candles, pine needle baskets derby cars and produced radio programs by the dozens...  All of it was tremendous fun. I would do it all again if I could💙

text: I visited this place once a year for the past 10 years, each time they have some improvement to surprise me. An awesome place for Christian to have a meeting, rest, good time, and worship together.

name: Matthew Jungling
text:
Shocco Springs is an amazing camp center. I had the ability to go when our youth camp decided to come for summer camp. The camp is run through Student Life Camps and has an amazing group of staff and individuals that help the camp run. The guys in our group including me stayed in Mount Moriah, which is one of the many lodging buildings available to stay in. The rooms were clean and fresh bedding was provided, although we brought our own. I opted to use the provided bedding. The rooms had two bunk beds for a maximum capacity of 4 people. The lower level of Mount Moriah (we stayed in the top level--a two story building) has a nice little lobby area with some chairs and a couch. Some guys in our group thought it would be funny to take the couch upstairs and place it in front of our leader's room. We returned the couch afterwards.

The rest of the camp was very beautiful and well kept. There were some lawn care professionals maintaining the grounds while we stayed.

The recreation area, known as the "Adventure Camp" was very nice. The pool was large enough for our group to comfortably play in, as well as others. A diving board added to the fun. The Tennis courts and Basketball courts were very nice and well kept, but you will need to bring your own tennis supplies, as they are not provided. There was a small "lake" on camp grounds, with paddle boarding, and some water inflatables. We did not decide to go on these as they cost an extortionate amount of $8 for 30 mins of play. Not worth it.

It would we worth nothing that everything is fairly spread apart and there are some very intense hills throughout, which took a toll on our legs and knees. Golf Cart rentals were available for $35/day, but we had too many in our group that it would cost too much, so we didn't do it.

The food service was very nice, the food tasted adequate and there was always a variety to choose from. It is a self serve food line, so you are free to eat what you choose. A nice addition is the unlimited complimentary Soft Serve Ice Cream available at each and every meal.

Overall I have to say Shocco Springs is one of my favourite camps that I've been to. Sure it's a little hot here in Alabama, but that's fine. Just bring some water, and going swimming can help tremendously.

-Matthew J., age 15 at time of writing. Visited From June 1-5, 2016. Home town: Abilene, TX.

name: Nicholas Blackstock
text:
Beautiful campgrounds here!

This is a well-kept Christian campsite! Includes several trails, a lake with several water-involved accommodations, fire pits etc. Everything you'd expect from an outdoor campgrounds facility. The dorm-style living and all of the buildings that I've ever gone in during my two visits here... are all very nice and designed well! Everything is clean and feels comfortable to live in for however long you're there. From the heart of birmingham, might take you 20-30 to get out there... depending on traffic, weather, and all other factors that disturb travel times.

If you ever have a reason to go, I think you'll appreciate what this large campground facility has to offer!

Any camp you go to, when it's hosted there, will be great. The counselors are so devoted to God. Everything is Spirit led. I grew with God. My relationship got deeper with Him. If you stay at a camp there, I hope you will too.

text:
Beautiful camp for kids!  They host AP camp, and we love it.  The camp grounds are fun and in a safely tucked away area.  Worth it, as kids love it.  It has been getting upgrades recently as well.  If you are reading this - yes, this place is worth supporting.  Kids love it, and they come back happy!  Totally worth it for your family and for the community, including adjacent states around it!!!

Hurray for ICYC!  Hurray for AP Christian Evidences camp!  Keep up the great work with all of these young minds!  They are stronger, happier, and better off for it!!!

name: Alex Ream
text: I have been a Trussville Y member for three years and still believe in the great value the Y membership has to offer. My only wish is extending evening hours for those who want to visit after work. But I understand the pandemic has affected the operations schedule quite a bit.

resp.text: We are pleased you have chosen the YMCA as your partner in Healthy Living and are committed to providing the best possible experience for you and your family.  We have extended our hours Monday-Thursday 5:00am-8:00pm, Friday 5:00am-7:00pm and Saturday 8:00am-5:00pm, Sunday 12:00pm-5:00pm.  Thank you so much for sharing your thoughts with us ! See you at the Y!!!!

name: Steven Baker
text: I love the equipment at the Y! The staff is awesome and helpful. Everyone is really friendly! I highly recommend the YMCA for getting yourself into shape.

name: John Rankin
text:
I've been going to the Trussville YMCA for about ten years.  The staff is consistently cordial, helpful, and very busy, working with a diverse gender-age membership with various needs and preferences for exercise.

I would like to see two or three more smith machines, as they allow typical basic weightlifting exercises without a partner to spot you. Especially helpful when flexibility, balance, and form are not what they used to be.

resp.text:
John,

Thank you for the comment.  We strive to provide excellent customer service at all times and sincerely appreciate you recognizing that effort.  We are also always looking for ways to improve and continue to make our members happy.  Thank you again for taking the time to provide feedback for our staff.

name: Delores Armstrong
text: I Love the Y @Trussville!!!  The staff is great, facility is clean and well managed.  The group classes are the best.  I especially enjoy the community engagement from the blood drives to the scholarships for those less fortunate.  The YMCA is a jewel in the Trussville community.

resp.text: Thank you Delores!  You are so sweet and we have really appreciated the time that you have volunteered to the Trussville Y!

name: George Barnett
text: The Trussville YMCA has foresight when it helps the area wide community with many needs. Families all over the region benefit from coat, food, and blood drives hosted at the Trussville YMCA. After school care for those who may not always be able to afford the cost. Welcoming place to exercise and be more healthy.

resp.text: Hi George!  Thank you for your kind words!  We have been truly blessed to have such wonderful members who have contributed to each of these causes and helped make our community stronger! - Dana

name: Kathleen Langsdale
text:
As an upcoming senior citizen, I love the fact the Trussville Y offers membership scholarships to those who are unable to join because of their income.  Helping seniors is so important to help keep us "wiser adults" active and live longer and healthier.
The Trussville YMCA is a wonderful place for fellowship, exercise and overall fun for all ages.  In today's world, where can you go that is totally a positive atmosphere where you can get all 3 advantages.  And if you are in any sort of need, the Trussville Y is there to help even if it is outside their realm  They are an awesome place to join and enjoy!!!!!
•	Provide a place for fellowship, exercise, and fun

resp.text: Thanks Kathleen!  We are so glad that you've had such great experiences at our branch!  If you want to make sure you have ALL of the most current information about what's going on at the Trussville YMCA, you can follow us on Facebook (Trussville YMCA) or swing by the Welcome Center to update your email address so you get our monthly newsletter!  We look forward to seeing you soon. - Dana

name: Daishaun Morgan
text: Clean facilities and friendly staff. We visit this location the most, I think because of the upkeep, equipment variety, indoor pool, and staff.

name: Vicki Stanford
text: Great place to improve mobility and physical stamina. The staff is friendly and helpful, and there is a program for everyone. I swim laps and am beginning physical training to improve balance and strength. I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks Vicki!  We are so happy to hear about your personal progress!  Thanks for being one of our AMAZING members!

name: Denise folkerts
text: The Trussville YMCA is an asset to this community.  The staff is friendly and cares about the mission.  Staff is constantly working to support community with education classes and other projects. Good Job!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Denise!  We love supporting the community making a difference in the lives of those around us!

name: Alonzo Taylor
text:
A new member was complaining in the men's locker room today about a smell coming out the steam Room in the  Men's locker ROOM😳😢 is  filthy !!!!!! And stays that way I've been complaining about this for months!!! me and several other members was talking about this problem today and we agree it's no use of complaining about it because nothing will get done. Steam room walls are BROWN with DIRT and BACTERIA !!!!😢 most of the time the hot tub it's not working properly  or it's cold !!!! It's a shame when you have to go other YMCAs to go to a CLEAN facility
for your membership. I never have this problem when I go to the other branches in town!!! Shades Valley, Hoover , Pelham SPOT LESS!! I always see people in Maintenance Cleaning the locker room except for the Trussville location !!😢 I have never in my LIFE been to a GYM so filthy and dirty just hope no one catches a staph infection!!! Very disappointed.

resp.text: Hi Alonzo!  Thank you for your message.  I am so sorry to hear that you have not had a great experience at the Trussville YMCA.  I would love for you to contact me so I can talk to you more about your concerns and to let you know about some of the improvements and updates that are coming!  - Dana Larkin (205) 655-2224

name: juan waggoner
text: Love the gym just wished equipment in child care was cleaned better. My kid ended up catching MRSA from the dirty play equipment.

resp.text: Hi Juan!  I see that you haven't visited our facility in quite some time, so I wanted to reach out and let you know that since your last visit, we have had a few changes in management.  We would love to help you get re-engaged with the facility and make sure that you have a fabulous experience!   We are sorry to hear about any negative experience you've had at the Trussville YMCA, but please feel free to reach out to me anytime with questions or concerns!  - Dana (205) 655-2224

name: Bryan Blackmon
text: The Y is an excellent place to let off some steam or get some steam, in the steam rooms. This is one of the very few locations in the Birmingham Metro area that has a swimming pool that is open year around and that is fantastic.

name: Brent Smith
text: Rude staff, especially the director. If you dont work for a living, they will give memberships away. However, those of us who go to work everyday and pay our bills; they charge out the nose.

resp.text: We apologize for your bad experience. We do offer financial assistance for a reduced rate. We would like to have an opportunity to change your mind about the Y.  Please contact Kim Ryals at KRyals@ymcabham.org

name: Josh Philliy
text: Everything is awesome, especially the staff. But I just wish we had another basketball court or something. Because I hate being kicked off the court for basketball and volleyball practice.

resp.text:
Thank you for the review.  We have the basketball and Volleyball practice schedule posted, sorry for the inconvenience.
YMCA- Trussville

name: Lillian Clemens
text: Love it best place to swim do activities during the summer and a good place to work out

resp.text: We are glad you love the Y!  Thanks, Wendy

name: Jacob Wallace
text: It would be great if they would activities like volleyball in other gym and not kick kids off the basketball court

resp.text: Thank you for your suggestion.

name: venqu v
text: Great place to work out and swim. Wish theyd update the basketball area

resp.text:
Thank you for the review. We are looking into improving the basketball area.  Currently we replacing the floor in the cardio room.
Thank you,
Wendy Newland

name: Scott Crawford
text: As Ys go, the Trussville YMCA is one of the better ones. Large cardio room; free weight room and weight machines; full range of cardio and cross training classes; upstairs track; full sized basketball court; racquetball courts; tennis courts; full size pool with smaller lap pool; and locker rooms with steam room, whirl pool, and showers. The staff is courteous and maintain the gym well.

resp.text: Scott - Thank you for sharing! We are so happy to hear you are enjoying your experience being a member of the Y! We look forward to continuing to serve you.

name: Sam A
text: A. Safe place my boys can go to  for workout activities when there's no school or no after school activities

name: Linda Henry-Jones
text: The workers are very helpful and friendly

name: nicole Lockhart
text: It is a amazing place

resp.text: Nicole, thank you for sharing your love for the Trussville Y!

name: Southern Gypsy Pickers and off road
text:
It's very relaxing to sit next to the creek. They have a playground. Full hook ups for 30/50 amp.
The sewer is in the front of the camp sites. So be prepared for extra sewer hose. We will be going back to make more memories.

name: Walter Geiger
text: Kind of don't want to share this place because, I want to go back and not be told no vacancy. You can reserve and pay online. The amenities of a hot shower and clean restrooms complete the cold creek and not having do the deed in the forest. Has water and electrical hook up and still allows tents during the "Covid Pandemic," you can walk the trail along the creek to keep you "social distancing."

name: Brian White
text:
Nice, small, simple campground. Cool creek for swimming, chair sitting and relaxing.
Side note: We made reservations in advance and hurricane Sally came through and wrecked our plans for camping the following weekend. I was not going to ask for a refund. Without me even asking, they refunded our money. Good business and seem like nice folks.

Another side note:  We like to arrive and depart from EAST to WEST. the turn is a little tight from the other direction.

name: Barbara Carr
text: Quite place. Really like it here.

name: Daryl Bailes
text: This small cg was okay but not great.  We had 1 of only 5 campers there.  We never could locate the wifi, the grass was up to our knees and the office is unfinished.  But there was a creek to cool us down in the heat of the day and we enjoyed the games they had and there was this cute cat...

name: Nick
text: Vintage camper/glampers do not support this campground they are very judgemental and only like new campers stop making campgrounds like this rich stay away

name: Kathrina Laude
text: Pet friendly family oriented beautiful view

name: Mike and Shawna Hual
text: Great campground with a creek flowing around the grounds.  Quiet with full hookups and good Verizon signal.

name: Joanne Smallwood
text: Beautiful, quiet, peaceful and relaxing! Love this place! Highly recommended staying here!!! We ended up here getting away from Hurricane Michael. We will come back here under better circumstances, tho. This is a nice little getaway spot! Playground for kids...games for adults...nice bathroom/showers. Decent amount of space between campers. Every site has a fire pit, grill and table. The bench swings overlooking the creek are my favorite part!!!!

name: Elaine Armstrong
text: What a wonderful c g. We evacuated from SE Florida and this was our only hope. Paul & Rachel were so helpful and accommodating. Prepared food for all campers for two days. But most of all helped relieve our stress.. We highly recommend this c g for its beautiful location and gracious hospitality.

name: Alexis Lindahl
text: We came to Creekside family campground to escape hurricane Irma. The owners of the campground have been the most friendly, accommodating, helpful people I have ever met. We have two small children and they set up a kids bouncy house, kiddy pool and many activities for the whole family. The site is beautiful, well maintained and very peaceful/relaxing. There is a creek and beach with a lot to do to entertain kids. Creekside family campground has been the most incredible experience and we are so thankful we found this campsite. I highly recommend staying here- If I could give 10+ stars I would!

name: Loving Adoption
text: Beautiful property with a welcoming, family fun feel. Lots for the kiddos to do. Bathrooms are clean and the community porch is inviting. Great place to relax and enjoy time with your loved ones.

name: John Townsend
text: It was great! Our problem is the site has a lot of broken glass! I picked up a good handful & there is still a lot left.

name: Alan Smith
text: This campground is very family friendly. Safe place for the children to play with each other and there also is a playground for the children to play on.

name: Theresa Kilcrease
text: This is an awesome family campground!!  The owners are very friendly and accommodating.  We will definitely be returning!!!

name: Barbara Tomei
text: Can't say enough good things about Creekside Family Campground!! Just spent 6 days there running from Irma! The McCloud family cooked out all weekend & fed everyone there. Highly recommend & great place If u r traveling with kids. Wonderful little beach & creek to cool off in. We hated to leave, but will surely be back!! Met some wonderful people during our stay!! You gotta go!!!

name: pumpkin wusky
text: This are lying people.if you are not in there click than you are not welcome.

name: Tina Jones
text: Great place. Fyi there was a small bit of trash in the fire pits.

name: Ron Desjardins
text: Excellent facilities, great staff, and very clean camp sites.  I have become a regular customer in the last month and plan to continue using this camp ground in the future.

name: michael adams
text: Awesome Family Campground

name: Jessie Newton
text: Great spot

name: Paul McLeod
text: Opening May 12th

name: Brian Habig
text: A one-of-a-kind camp and staff culture.

name: David McCaughtry
text: Beautiful camp and facilities

name: Archibald Hill
text: I will never forget my time at Alpine as a camper

name: Hailey Holloway
text: Beautiful place .Great out doors flying squirels and paddle boats  kayaks

name: Taylor Citrin
text: I was a camper at Alpine for 8 years. If you want to learn more about Christ and have a great time doing it, this is where you want to spend your summer. You will build friendships with guys who will affect your life in the best way possible. Mohawk forever!

name: anonymous inc.
text:
Alpine is on of those places, that when you leave you can't wait until you come back. It's november right now, and I feel like camp was yesterday.
Also the negative review on Alpine is completely inaccurate.

name: Grouchy Corpse
text: I have gone to this camp for 7 years now. This year will be my 8th year in a row to go. It has a very Christian atmosphere. If you are not religious. You can just ignore the prayers,  and not pay attention in church. I am a believer of Christ though. I would send my child here if i had one. 1. Great food 2. Lots of activities 3. Bonding relationships with one another 4. A Pattie at the end of the experience. 5. You go on a trip depending on your age to Chattanooga or white water rafting, or roller coasters. Will post pictures later.

name: Samuel Rice
text: Alpine is the most wonderful place in tje world. Though I left it today I have 11 months to dream about next year. Thank you lord for Alpine.

name: Kearl Hat
text: I went to this camp as a kid. It offers the usual canoeing, archery, crafts activities. The main theme of this camp, however, is indoctrination into the Christian faith. We had to pray about 12 times daily and sing religious songs. Activities suspected of conflicting with Christianity where forbidden - my age saw the outlawing of Dungeons & Dragons, I'm not sure what is being forbidden these days. This is a good camp for Jesus Freak parents (you know who you are) who want to continue the ole indoctrination routine. If you are even the least bit secular, believe in religious tolerance, or don't want your son frothed up in a religious fervor, you should look elsewhere in your quest to get rid of junior for the summer. Good Luck

name: Will Miller
text: Alpine Camp changed my life - Thank you Lord for Alpine.

name: Robert Pettit
text: Thank you Lord for Alpine

name: Ruthie Collins
text: I have never been anywhere so beautiful and loving. It really opens my heart. Thank you DeSoto :)

name: T
text:
I was Camp DeSoto's FedEx Express courier for 12 years. Today I listened to part of a radio call in program about Christian camps. I thought back to the camps in Mentone and decided to write this review.

I delivered to Camp DeSoto almost every day of camping season for 12 years.

I was always very impressed by the Hurt family and their staff members. They are terrific people who put lots of effort into their work. They take pride and satisfaction in working together to do an important job well.

The campers always seemed to be having a great time as good friends or reading a letter or book outdoors. The ones who held the door for me were very polite, respectful, and enjoyed being helpful. I got the impression that while having a lot of fun being kids they were being well prepared for their present and for their future lives

This is a Christian camp in all the best senses of that term. If I had a daughter, I would send her to Camp DeSoto. It would be money well spent.

name: Mallory Cassell
text:
Desoto  holds a special place in my heart, I have learned so much here and still have more to learn!   I can not explain how much this camp means to me.

I am true to the red white and blue

name: Sarah Lawton Hawkins
text: Camp DeSoto has shaped my life - taught me to see the world and others in a different and beautiful way!

name: Alexa Robinson
text: This place is my home away from home, my happy place. I have too many memories from here to count. The way they teach but also learn from us is amazing. I count down the day every year till I can come back to the mountain. So I can fellowship with the lord, because I love to feel my spirit soar! Five stars will always be what my second home deserves.

name: Jennifer Foster
text: This will be my daughters second summer at Camp Desoto. This camp will have a life long impact on my girls. They have made so many amazing friendships, learned so much and enjoyed so much. Phil and Marsha are awesome!

name: mollymaudbrown
text: Camp DeSoto is the finest camp/ life experience a girl will ever have. The things she will learn their will last a lifetime. I was a camper and counselor and my daughter (10) will be in her 3rd summer. The friendships made will be the most important and lasting in her life too. Do what you can to send you girl here!

name: Sabyn
text: Any amount of time spent at Camp Desoto is well worth it!

name: amanda perry
text: Desoto is my favorite place to go.It is like my 2nd home.😀

name: Kaylee Powell
text: Great getaway for our youth group winter camp! So much to enjoy and plenty of space to roam and enjoy the outdoors!

name: taylor ford
text: It is a great bible summer camp! If you want something to do during the summer the go to Ponderosa Bible Camp.

name: Zachary Hill
text: I was a camper here and boy was it fun. It is the experience of a lifetime mixed in with learning about God's word. There are many fun activities here and the food is amazing.

name: Shaddix
text: Garbage. More like a cult than a retreat.

name: cameron mcelrath
text: A place for kids to camp and have fun with others a bible camp

name: Syd & Tay's Adventures
text: The best camp for kids of all ages. They have my complete trust. My girls are finishing up their third time here this week. All camps in this area are in the $$$$ thousands. Here it is minimal in comparison and they truly care about each child.

name: Jacob Taylor
text: Awesome  bible camp, staff is on fire for the Lord, and they love kids

name: jasmine.danielle
text: Ponderosa bible camp is somewhere good and fun for kids to go. All kids of all ages can go and they have teenagers that are very helpful the camp is really fun

name: Page Johnson
text: I have been here twice.  The people are friendly and joyful!  God's Word is taught here with love and individual attention to all who come.  Relax and feel at home here.

name: Tina Harper
text: Beautiful camp and Miss Sherry and L WM always host an amazing experience for the children to be in the presence of the Lord!

name: joe defranco
text: The kids had a great time. They'll be back.

name: Arden Shanklin
text: Spent many of my summers here. The staff invest into everything that they do for the glory of God.

name: Bill Martin
text: It's a great experience.  The camp is organized and well run.

name: Jason Jackson
text: Love this place

name: David Tucker
text: Wonderful ministry.  My son worked there and we have supported it for many years.

name: cyndi marie
text: The kids love the camp. Friendly Christian camp.

name: Summer Cunningham
text: We love the camp and ours children did also

name: Dee Hinkle
text: Great ministry with exciting activities for the campers.

name: marsha robertson
text: my grand daughter went thier she loved it

name: Ray Harris
text: Awesome place! Staff is WONDERFUL!!!!

name: Patrick Cunningham
text: A truly blessed place to be..

name: Herb Wright
text:
(Translated by Google) ehhh

(Original)
Ehhh

name: Virginia Branson
text: We "rented" this camp for a week for 80 children in our organization. The camp was beautiful, and very well maintained. The cottages, the gym, and the dining room were spotless. There was a comfortable chapel, with a small elevated stage and a very nice sound system. The beautiful swimming pool was crystal clear, and all the lifeguard equipment was present and functional. Maintenance staff was on campus in case we needed anything at all (and we did need more paper towels at one point). I hope we continue at this camp every year!

name: Lynn Barclay
text: Awesome place of worship. The ground as soon as you set foot down feels Holy.

name: JoAnn Ulmer
text: I have enjoyed many times here. I started going to camp at the age of 12 and now I attend other events. I also used to work in camp. A lot of good memories here.

name: Lyanna Upton
text: We love camp and look forward to it every year!

name: Lynn Vick
text: Picked up grandson from camp. He had a great experience and will be back next year

name: 999 nation Iii
text: I’m going this year and I went last year I want to be in Zack cabin again

name: Lily Smith
text: It's the best church camp to go to. It is so much fun

name: Judy Lawrence
text: Nice facilities for Wonder book camp 80th anniversary celebration! Clean and well kept grounds.

name: Jason knowles
text: Great summer adventure for the kids with a Christian atmosphere.

name: Albert Conner
text: Very clear place for the young people to visit and be together.

name: Bee Smith
text: Love love love camp! WBC

name: Greg Pennington
text: Easy to get to from the interstate .

name: Turner Robert
text: Good to see

name: Brenda Battles
text: Love it

name: Laylani Larry
text: I love this camp soooo sooo much!!! Me and my sister can´t stop talking about it till now! We hoped coming this summer but the stuff going on is really much. Again, we really hoped coming and being there for the summer again and seeing our already known friends and making new friends. The picture that I put is me and my sister coming from camp last year. Camp Cosby is important to me because of how much love that goes around and the songs that we share with each other to make us feel comfortable. We love every single counselor there. The director Karen, thank you so much! This really goes for everyone and the guy director, I can´t really remember his and other names right now sorry! I´m really looking forward to this illness that´s going around to wear off so that me and my sister could be able to come there! Food, perfect! Counselors, Staff, Director´s, Everyone, Awesome! Cabin mates, Great! Most of all Activities, Amazing! Fun! Awesome! Outstanding! every good describing work out there!! Everything is the best! No bad reports on this camp! This camp is now my second home!! My home that I would love to go to every summer! I´m going to miss the camp if any other things happen. But anyways I would love to talk more but I have work to do, Bye Bye!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your sweet reply Laylani! We miss y'all this year and hope you will be back soon!

name: Greg Pharo
text: Both of our kids really loved Camp Cosby! And I enjoyed it years ago when I was young. It's fun and well-run.

resp.text: Thank you Greg!  We are so glad the Cosby tradition continues with your family.  Hoping for many more years!

name: EB Speakman
text: We had a lot of fun at Camp Cosby and the staff are the best. It takes a lot of patience to work with kids and show them what it is like to experience nature.

name: Shelbi Creel
text: I love camp! It’s so awesome! So many fun songs and Dances it’s just great! And you make friends for a lifetime!❤️❤️

resp.text: Thank you Shelbi so much for your positive feedback.  We are thrilled we were able to provide you with a great camp experience!

name: Staci Sulhoff
text: A great summer camp experience growing up!  Influenced  and changed my life in so many ways!  Beautiful setting on the lake with lots of programs and activities such as horses, skiing, tubing, minibikes, archery, arts/crafts, alpine tower, zip line, sailing, canoeing...too much to do in one week.  Plus the cabin life and activities are some of the most memorable times! Great staff that is focused on the children and making sure they are having the week of a life time.  My own children now carry on this wonderful tradition where they learn core values like respect, responsibility, honesty and caring.

name: Terri Lane Robertson
text: We had a 3-day field trip and enjoyed it thoroughly! Great staff and activities. "Camp clean" cabins and bathrooms. Highly recommend this place!

resp.text: Terri, thanks for your great feeback regarding your visit to YMCA Camp Cosby - we are thrilled your experience was a positive one, that is always our goal - we hope you are able to return one day!

name: DeLane
text: Cosby is the greatest Camping experience around!!!

resp.text: Hey Delane - We're glad you think so, and we are in complete agreement!

name: CJ Stewart
text: Camp Cosby definitely changes everyone who visits. It's my favorite place on the planet and I'd recommend it to anyone that wants an amazing place to spend their summer.

name: K9 Miso
text: Great place for kids

name: Bryant archer
text: Does bill give out jello and puts you to sleep?

name: Sydney Bloeme
text: I wouldn't be the person I am today without this place. It gave me the confidence and self esteem I was lacking as a kid.

name: jennifer nall
text: Best. Camp. Ever!

resp.text: Thanks Jennifer -  we think so too!  Glad you loved it!

name: fernando carreño
text: Best camp

resp.text: Fernando, that's great  - come back again next year!

name: Thomas Greene
text: fun with my son

name: Preston Sellers
text: I've been a camper, LIT, CIT, and Counselor and you could not find a better camp to be a part of!

name: Tracy Andrews
text: Awesome Facilities

name: Lynn Sullivan
text: It doesn't get any better than camp cosby.

name: Joe Impello
text:
Awesome!!
We live around the corner and use the field and play ground.
They allow the neighborhood to utilize their site. They are truly a good neighbor!

name: Theresa warr
text: Great.We really enjoyed ourselves today!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Dominique Edwards
text: Went hear 17 years ago. Honestly one of the best memories from my childhood me an my sister literary share stories about this place we did EVERYTHING! I loved swimming even thou I never made to the deep end. The talent show was so Litt couldn’t tell us we weren’t superstars. I really cried on the last day an begged our troop leader to let me stay!

name: Karen Lands
text: Went there in 1973_1976 it was one of my greatest memories,I loved everything about that place,cooking Rice Krispy treats in the white house,campingHiking,talent shows,moviers,swimming,to taking care of your garden. back then you stayed two weeks,I wanted to stay the whole summer,I can say enjoy every minute ,time goes by way too fast...karen lands

name: Mary Marsh
text: It was a wonderful experience. I had a great time with different families and people.

name: Gary Grimes
text: Nice environment for kids.  Lots of fresh air every day.

name: Maria Escobedo
text: The people there are very welcoming, positive environment!!

name: Pat Garlikov
text: Working at the garden!

name: Angelle Morris
text: It's an awesome spot, I went to visit as a camp for my son this summer, but I wanted to be a camper. Very nice and the staff is very warm and welcoming.

name: J T
text: We only went for a block party and didn't really explore but the grounds were well kept and the kids liked the playground.

name: Jennifer Boothe
text: Pretty

name: Theresa Ward
text: Love this place

name: The dancing chef CD MCDANIEL
text: My favorite place ever as a child

name: Dave O'Leary
text: This place is a gem.

name: David Oleary
text: No place like it anywhere!  Go there if you get a chance!

name: Scott S
text: Management is no good

name: Khandi Whisenant
text: Great Summer camp for kids

name: Loren Rodgers
text: Our two daughters stayed for the week and had an amazing time. They said the food was great and they had the best time. They can't wait for next year.

name: S B
text: It's simply an awesome place.

name: Lawrence Murison
text: Was good for my son

name: Julie Pechon
text: Excellent experience.  The camp counselors are St. Bernard students that truly enjoy their job. Campers are on the mover from 7 in the morning til well after dark experiencing archery,fishig,canoeing  and team games to name a few.

name: Patty Davis
text: Plenty of activities for kids aged 6 to 14. Well staffed with awesome caring counselors. Beautiful campus and organized activities both on and off campus. Safety ensured by close supervision of staff. My granddaughter looks forward to this every summer!

name: Herbert Washington
text: Wonderful! Wonderful! This place is for healing and getting on the right tract with your life. The place makes you feel engulfed by the Holy Spirit. Come sisters and brothers...Go!

name: TITO Tito
text: Wonderful place. Clean rooms, very soft beds. Great bookstore. Many places to just relax and enjoy the surroundings. Highly recommend.

name: Michael Johnston
text: Going to the strawberry festival this Saturday hoping for a good day to look around have fun. So everyone come out have fun.   If weather permits

name: Gregory Bazile
text: A very peaceful place where you can pray in a beautiful church. You will love visiting the Grotto.

name: Gary Contreras
text: Go to school here it's great!!

name: Troy Joslyn
text: Its always beautiful

name: Olivia Ja
text: Very good summer camp, busy with activities.

name: Mary Morris
text: The youth group singing was awesome

name: Darren Pechon
text: Serenity and relaxation are rampant emotions when you arrive at the campus.

name: Robert Hunter
text: Always have fun events.

name: kathy daniel
text: Great place

name: Diane Glover
text: Good organizations to help them with Cerebral Palsy.

name: Lisa Ruiz
text: Very clean and we'll maintained. Super friendly, accommodating staff. Lots to do and pricing is very reasonable. Our group will go back again for sure!

name: Heather Free
text: Great place ..churches do Easter egg hunt here

name: Blake Hargrove
text: We went here for a retreat,l. It's a great place to take a group to get away from everything. The location is great for folks that live in the Huntsville, as it doesn't take more than an hour to get there.

name: Yamaly Montanez
text: What a great place to take the youth!!! We enjoyed our time at this camp!!! Cant wait for next year!!

name: Jathan Martin (Arthur Ritis)
text: Has a good pool and a nice gym and a lot of room to have fun

name: Bert Breland
text: Excellent place for a church retreat.

name: Bryan Medlen
text: Beautiful facilities and staff was very nice and helpful

name: Jonathan Bottomlee
text: Best place for a church outing

name: C.J.
text: Church Camp!

name: Noah Olsen
text: Beautiful scenery
